titles.title: The labio-velar glide /w/ in German Learner English: Dataset for chapter 7 in "Phonological variation in German Learner English"

contributor.contributorName: The Tromsø Repository of Language and Linguistics
contributor.familyName: Tromsø Repository of Language and Linguistics

rightsList.rights:
This dataset, "The labio-velar glide /w/ in German Learner English: Dataset for chapter 7 in "Phonological variation in German Learner English"", may be reused according to the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license as described here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.

The data contained in the tabular file "w_data_pascoe.csv" has been extracted from tables and other parts of the following academic work:

Pascoe, Graham. 1987. Die Aussprache des Englischen an bayerischen Schulen. München: Profil.

and rearranged into the tabular form in the file "w_data_pascoe.csv".

Therefore, the data from Pascoe (1987) as reused in the file "w_data_pascoe.csv" represent facts and are reused under Public Domain conditions as described here: https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/pdm/.

The data contained in the tabular file "w_data_rank.csv" are based on data extracted from the following academic work:

Rank, Isabel. 2016. Hypercorrection of /v/ amongst advanced German L2 learners of English: Phonetic and speaker-dependent factors. Unpublished term paper, University of Bamberg, Germany.

These data are here reused according to the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license as described here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ with the permission from the author (see the file "data_consent_rank.pdf").

The data contained in the tabular file "w_data_wunder.csv" are based on data extracted from the following academic work:

Wunder, Christina. 2012. Final devoicing in German Learner English: A study at a Franconian grammar school. University of Bamberg, Germany MA thesis.

These data are here reused according to the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) license as described here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ with the permission from the author (see the file "data_consent_wunder.pdf").

descriptions.description: This dataset contains tabular files with auditory classifications for /w/ produced by German learners of English. The data originate from four different studies. The data by Pascoe (1987) include n = 26 speakers (instructional-setting learners from southern Bavaria; age: 14-16 years), who produced a total of n = 323 tokens. These data were elicited with the re-telling of a picture story. The data by Wunder (2012) include n = 30 speakers (instructional-setting learners from northern Bavaria; age: 11-20), who produced a total of n = 420 tokens. These data were elicited with the reading passage. The data by Soenning (2020) include n = 62 speakers (instructional-setting learners from northern Bavaria; age: 11-30), who produced a total of n = 1152 tokens. These data were elicited with two reading tasks, a word list and short question-answer sequences. The data by Rank (2016) include n = 26 speakers (mostly from southern Germany (Bavaria) who had learned English in an instructional context for at least 7 consecutive years; the sample may be considered as representing intermediate to advanced proficiency levels), who produced a total of n = 1196 tokens. These data were elicited with a word list and a reading passage. See ReadMe file for more details. Related publication: Soenning, Lukas. 2020. Phonological variation in German Learner English. University of Bamberg dissertation. DOI: 10.20378/irb-49135 Open access: https://fis.uni-bamberg.de/handle/uniba/49135
